Vegan Eggnog

Jump to Recipe

As the holiday season approaches, the craving for festive beverages intensifies, and what better way to celebrate than with a creamy, indulgent Vegan Eggnog? This delightful plant-based version captures the rich, comforting flavors of traditional eggnog without the use of dairy or eggs. Made with wholesome ingredients like almond milk and coconut cream, this Vegan Eggnog is not only easy to prepare but also suitable for those following a vegan lifestyle. Whether you're hosting a holiday party or simply looking for a cozy drink to enjoy by the fire, this recipe will satisfy your festive spirit. With hints of nutmeg and cinnamon, and the option to add a splash of rum or bourbon, this Vegan Eggnog is sure to impress both vegans and non-vegans alike. Discover how to whip up this deliciously creamy drink in just a few simple steps, and make your celebrations even merrier!

Ingredients

almond milk

Choose unsweetened almond milk to control sweetness, or substitute with other non-dairy milks like soy or oat milk for a creamier texture. If you prefer homemade, blend soaked almonds with water and strain for fresh almond milk.

coconut cream

Use full-fat coconut milk for a similar texture if coconut cream is unavailable. To make your own coconut cream, refrigerate a can of full-fat coconut milk overnight and scoop out the solidified cream. If you want a lighter version, use coconut milk instead.

maple syrup

For a different flavor profile, try agave syrup or brown rice syrup as substitutes. You can also reduce the amount for a less sweet drink or use a sugar-free option, such as monk fruit sweetener, if you are counting calories.

vanilla extract

Use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor. If you don’t have it, you can substitute with vanilla bean paste or a dash of vanilla powder. For a unique twist, consider adding almond extract for a more complex flavor.

nutmeg

Freshly grated nutmeg provides a more intense flavor than pre-ground. If you don’t have nutmeg, you can use allspice or a small pinch of cloves as alternatives. Be cautious with the amount, as they are stronger spices.

ground cinnamon

Use Ceylon cinnamon for a sweeter, more delicate flavor compared to cassia cinnamon. If you want to experiment, consider adding a dash of cardamom for additional warmth and depth.

rum or bourbon (optional)

If you prefer a non-alcoholic version, you can enhance the flavor by adding a few drops of rum or bourbon extract instead. For a different twist, consider spiced rum for added warmth and flavor.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Combine Almond Milk and Coconut Cream

    In a large mixing bowl, pour in 4 cups of almond milk and 1 cup of coconut cream. The coconut cream will add a rich, creamy texture to your eggnog.

  • Step 2: Add Sweetness and Flavor

    To the mixture, add 1/2 cup of maple syrup and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. These ingredients will provide natural sweetness and enhance the flavor profile of your eggnog.

  • Step 3: Incorporate Spices

    Sprinkle in 1 teaspoon of nutmeg and 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. These spices are essential for that classic eggnog taste and aroma.

  • Step 4: Whisk Until Smooth

    Using a whisk, blend all the ingredients together until the mixture is well combined and creamy. Make sure there are no lumps, and the coconut cream is fully incorporated.

  • Step 5: Add Alcohol (Optional)

    If you want an alcoholic version, gently stir in 1/2 cup of rum or bourbon. This step is optional but adds a traditional kick to your eggnog.

  • Step 6: Serve and Garnish

    Pour the vegan eggnog into glasses, serve chilled or over ice. For an extra touch, sprinkle a little additional nutmeg on top for garnish.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I measure liquid ingredients accurately?

Use a liquid measuring cup for ingredients like almond milk and coconut cream. Fill the cup to the desired measurement and check at eye level for accuracy.

What can I use instead of coconut cream?

If you don't have coconut cream, you can use full-fat coconut milk or a non-dairy whipped topping for a similar creamy texture.

How can I make sure the nutmeg and cinnamon mix well?

To ensure the spices are evenly distributed, you can whisk the nutmeg and cinnamon into the liquid ingredients rather than adding them separately.

Is there a vegan substitute for eggs in recipes?

In this recipe, there are no eggs needed! But if you're looking for egg substitutes in other recipes, try using flaxseed meal or applesauce.

How do I know if my eggnog is chilled enough?

Chill the eggnog in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving, or until it's cooled to your desired temperature. You can also serve it over ice for a refreshing touch.

Can I add other flavors to my vegan eggnog?

Absolutely! Feel free to experiment with flavors like almond extract, cardamom, or even a splash of coffee for a unique twist.

What should I do if my eggnog is too thick?

If your eggnog is thicker than you like, simply add a little more almond milk and whisk until you reach your desired consistency.

How do I serve vegan eggnog?

Serve your eggnog in chilled glasses, over ice if preferred, and garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg or a cinnamon stick for a festive touch.

How long can I store leftover vegan eggnog?

Store any leftover eggnog in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Shake or stir it well before serving again.

Can I make vegan eggnog ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare it a day in advance. Just keep it refrigerated and remember to give it a good whisk before serving.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This Vegan Eggnog is suitable for those following a plant-based diet as it contains no animal products. For nut allergies, substitute almond milk with oat milk or soy milk. If you prefer a sugar-free version, you can use a sugar alternative like agave syrup or stevia in place of maple syrup. Additionally, the recipe can be made gluten-free by ensuring that all ingredients are certified gluten-free, especially the optional alcoholic component.

Pairings

Pair the Vegan Eggnog with spiced ginger cookies or peppermint bark for a festive treat. For a heartier accompaniment, consider serving it alongside a warm vegan pumpkin pie or a chocolate cake. To enhance the experience, serve with a spiced chai tea or a light-bodied red wine such as Pinot Noir, which complements the nutmeg and cinnamon flavors beautifully.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Vegan Eggnog in festive glasses or mugs, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg or a cinnamon stick for an elegant touch. For a party setting, create a decorative punch bowl for self-serving, and provide additional toppings like whipped coconut cream or chocolate shavings for guests to customize their drinks. Consider serving it chilled, or over ice for a refreshing contrast, especially on warmer winter nights.

#

Vegan Eggnog

10 min
$10
150 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

Tree Nuts

Dietary Tags:

VeganDairy-FreeGluten-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

BeverageDessert

Tags:

BeverageHolidayFestive

Description

A creamy, spiced plant-based drink perfect for the holidays!

Ingredients

  • almond milk: 4 cups
  • coconut cream: 1 cup
  • maple syrup: 1/2 cup
  • vanilla extract: 2 teaspoons
  • nutmeg: 1 teaspoon
  • ground cinnamon: 1 teaspoon
  • rum or bourbon (optional): 1/2 cup

Date Created:

11/21/2024
